Sakura is Japanese for this tree, celebrated for its blossoms in spring
Literally "growing" in Italian, this music term is a gradual increase in loudness
Hebrew for "to life" or "to your health", it's used as a toast

IPA, to a bartender

clues.response: the Knights Hospitaller or the Knights of Malta

clues.text: After Crusaders captured this city in 1098, they found the relic called the holy lance, though not the holy hand grenade

Broken down into hue, saturation & brightness, it can be defined as the sensation felt as waves of light hit the retina

rounds.text: Pope Urban VIII once said, "if there is a God," this French minister "will have much to answer for. If not, he had a successful life"
